name: propane, burned in building machine | propane, burned in building machine | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/10847/documentation

This dataset represents the combustion of propane in a building machine. It is adapted from ecoinvent v3.0 dataset "diesel, burned in building machine, GLO 2001". ;Modified flows: ;Carbon dioxide, fossil emissions: stoichiometric calculation based on hypothetical commercial propane composition (see table below); Sulfur dioxide emissions: stoichiometric calculation based on sulfur content; propane fuel input, Nitrogen oxides, Carbon monoxide, fossil and Particulates, <2.5Âµm emissions taken from U.S. EPA NONROAD 2008 model for LGT252 machines (Phase II emission standard (post-2007), over 25 HP, liquid petroleum gas fuelled).; Commercial propane composition: 90% propane and propene; 10% ethane, ethene, butane and butene; and 0.005% (w/w) sulfur content (http://www.cfbp.fr/proprietes-des-gpl/specifications-administratives-n312, consulted on 2013-05-29);;. The following table shows the calculation for energy content and carbon dioxide emissions (individual hydrocarbons heating values taken from Table B.1 in Felder, R. M., Rousseau, R. W. (1986) Elementary Principles of Chemical Processes, 2nd ed.,Wiley):

This activity starts with the reception of the propane fuel.

This activity ends with the supplied service of the operating building machine.
The dataset includes the fuel for combustion, the infrastructure, lubricating oil and air emissions.
category: F:Construction/43:Specialized construction activities/431:Demolition and site preparation/4312:Site preparation

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Emission data extrapolated from Switzerland conditions, except for nitrogen oxides, carbon monoxide and particulates emissions extrapolated from U.S.A. conditions.The uncertainties have been adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: This dataset has been adapted from an original dataset covering the geography Switzerland for natural gas and building machine use. The uncertainty is adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: "Literature, manufacturers" and "Some data from the LCA study Oekoinventare von Energiesystemen 1996 and emissions from the Swiss "Offroad" database", as cited in ecoinvent dataset  "diesel, burned in building machine, GLO 2001".
